ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Over the past month, how often has your child: Had enough energy to participate in daily routines and activities?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Kept in good general health (e.g. avoided cough, colds, fever)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Slept well during the night?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Been alert and aware during the day?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Been in a good mood?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Smiled or brightened their facial expression?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Showed happiness through body language (e.g. making eye contact, body facing others)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Showed cheeky or comical mannerisms (e.g. laughed, giggled)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Been unsettled without an apparent reason?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Showed aggression (e.g. hitting, kicking, using offensive language, being destructive)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Appeared upset or angry (e.g. crying, screaming, moving or stiffening the body)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Become withdrawn with a low mood?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Deliberately hurt themselves?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Expressed discomfort with changes in routine (e.g. careers, school, respite, out-of-home care)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Showed signs of being anxious or agitated (e.g. teeth grinding, fast breathing, avoidance)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Expressed happiness when they were understood?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Appeared relaxed when making eye contact?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Initiated greetings with people verbally or nonverbally (e.g. eye contact)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed being included?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed the social experience of meal times?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Responded positively when others paid attention to them (e.g. your child smiled, showed interest)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Showed pleasure or excitement when looking forward to activities (e.g. going to school, outings, events)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed moving their body (e.g. crawling, walking, swinging, swimming)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed feeling steady or stable during physical activities (e.g. sitting, standing, bike riding)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed physical activities (e.g. going out for a walk, swimming, dancing)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed going on outings in the community (e.g. shopping, party, sports, theatre)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed spending time outdoors (e.g. contact with water, grass, wind, sunshine)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Expressed their needs (e.g. hunger, thirst, toileting)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Made their own choices for activities or things they enjoy (e.g. DVDs, toys)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Helped to complete routine activities (e.g. dressing, feeding)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed making things with their hands -- can be with help (e.g. building blocks, painting, cooking)?
Over the past month, how often has your child: Enjoyed using technology (e.g. computer, tablet, applications on phones)?
